skillTree.localised_description: Few magics can worm their way through this one's skull; their Khornate collar offers adequate protection, as does the impenetrable, relentless fury infecting his mind.
At times, this servant of Khorne storms across the battlefield with arrows lodged in his chest. However, they seem to do little but further stoke the raging fire of his wrath.
Fluttering and flouncing into battle is the way of the weak and self-indulgent. War should be waged Kharneth's way – with pure, unbridled savagery.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Slaaneshi factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Slaaneshi factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Enables the Barded Chaos Steed Mount

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Enables the Khorne Mammoth Mount

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Wrathcaller rejects cowardly magic tricks with such a strength that even the most powerful spells become harmless.

effects.description: Enables the "Locus of Abjuration" Unit Ability

skillTree.localised_description: A Wrathcaller knows nothing else, and instills it in all those around him.
The more blood is shed in Khorne´s name, the more power his favourite servants receive.

effects.description: Enables "The Gaze of Khorne" Unit Ability

skillTree.localised_description: More skulls for His Throne!
Look at them, trying to kill us from afar, so terrified that they dont dare to fight us! Ignore that, and wash your blades and armours with their blood!
The Wrathcaller always finds the bloodiest fight, and his followers will not be left behind.

effects.description: Enables the "Unleash the Inner Beast" Unit Ability

skillTree.localised_description: When a huge swathe of rage and violence descends upon the unready, very few survivors are left in its wake.
No foe remains a threat once torn limb from bloody limb!
"KILL! KILL THEM ALL!"
"Raze it all to the ground! Leave nothing standing!"
With every other thought squeezed from their mind, there is naught left of this one but the screaming song of slaughter.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Death, malice, butchery and murder – the enemies of Khorne shall have it all.
"None shall run far! None shall be able to hide! All will come to sufferance!"
"Modulistic terror – a vast, sadistic feast. The only way to exit is going piece by piece."
All will know agony, pulverised by the inescapable grip of the Blood God's hatred.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Come forth, warriors, show them who are the strongest! Blood for the Blood God!

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Khorne always needs, and always gets, more recruits from the tribes to kill and die in his name in pursuit of his blessing.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
This Khornate Lord's well of eternal rage never runs dry, nor does the ceaseless influx of warriors eager to serve under his command.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: There is no stopping this one's slaughter, for they are driven by the unquenchable lust for battle.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every skull taken in the Blood God's honour proves this one's loyalty to the Skull Throne.
This brutal Lord of Khorne decimates the lands of man and monster alike – the avatar or wrath incarnate!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
"Prisoners? What need of them have we? No, kill them all. Do it now. Kharneth demands it."
If you don't kill them outright, to spill their blood and scar them for life is almost as good.
"My hammer's a cold piece of blood-lethal steel. I grin while you writhe with the pain that I deal!"
If there's trouble to be had – and by that I mean the worst kind of slaughter – this one will always be at the centre of things, instigating the conflict.
